newsitem.title: HONG KONG: CLP says deferral could cost HK$2-3 bln.
newsitem.headline: CLP says deferral could cost HK$2-3 bln.

text.p: China Light & Power Co Ltd said on Tuesday delaying bringing its Black Point power station fully onstream could cost between HK$2 billion and HK$3 billion in extra capital expenditure over the life of the plant.
"We are pretty confident in our own set of figures," said Sandra Mak, a spokeswoman for the utility.
China Light on Monday agreed to defer units seven and eight of the power station for up to five years. The government and the company will review the situation in 1999.

Mak said a three-year deferral could lead to capital expenditure of HK$2 billion, and a five-year deferral would cost HK$3 billion. The plant has a life of 33 years in terms of civil works and 25 years in terms of equipment, she said.
The utility came under intense pressure to halt or defer the commissioning of some units of its eight unit Black Point power station because of a slowdown in growth in electricity demand.
China Light also agreed to decommission 442 megawatts of existing gas turbine capacity and to mothball the gas turbines.
